bibl.title: Yellow Fever. Descriptions of Epidemics in New Orleans, by [Mary Louise Marshall], [December 1, 1941]

div1.p: A list of publications on the yellow fever epidemics in New Orleans was sent to Hench by Marshall.

div1.head: Yellow Fever. Descriptions of Epidemics in New Orleans, by [Mary Louise Marshall], [December 1, 1941]
div1.opener:
THE TULANE UNIVERSITY OF LOUISIANA
NEW ORLEANS
----
SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
LIBRARY
1430 TULANE AVENUE

list.head: Descriptions of Epidemics of New Orleans
list.item:
1. Holt, Joseph: To the People of New Orleans: October 4th, 1905.
New Orleans, 1905.

2. De Plasse, Louis: Quelques mots sur les maladies miasmatiques et en
particulier sur la Fièvre Jaune à la Louisiane. New York, 1879.

3. Delery, Charles: Mémoire sur l'épidémie fièvre qui a régné à la
Nouvelle Orléans et dans les campagnes pendant l'année, 1867.
New Orleans, 1867.

4. Barton, E.H.: Account of the epidemic of yellow fever which prevailed
in New Orleans during the autumn of 1833. Phila., 1934.

5. Dowler, Bennet: Tableau of the yellow fever of 1853, with topographical,
chronological, and historical sketches of the epidemics of New
Orleans since their origin in 1796, illustrative of the quarantine
question. New Orleans, 1854.

6. Halphen, Michel: Mémoire sur la choléra-morbus compliqué d'une
épidémie de fièvre jaune, qui a régné simultanément à la Nouvelle
Orléans en 1832. Paris, 1933.

7. Chaillé, Stanford Emerson: The Yellow Fever, sanitary condition, and
vital statistics of New Orleans during its military occupation, the
four years 1862-5. (Dr. Chaillé was Prof. Physiology and Path. Anat.
Medl. Dept. Univ. of La.)

8. Thomas, P.F.: Essai sur la fièvre jaune d'Amerique, ou considerations
sur les causes; les symptómes, la nature et la traitement de cette
maladie, avec l'histoire de l'epidèmic de la Nouvelle Orléans en
1822. New Orleans, 1823.

9. Howard Assn. of New Orleans: Report of the Howard Assn. of New Orleans,
of receipts, expenditures and their work in the epidemic of 1878,
with names of contributions, etc. New Orleans, 1878.

10. Holt, Joseph: Analysis of the Record of Yellow Fever in New Orleans
during the year 1879. New Orleans, 1879.

11. New Orleans Auxiliary Sanitary Association: History of the yellow
fever epidemic in the Fourth District. Disinfection and fumigation;
sanitary conditions of the district; sanitary measures generally
considered. New Orleans, 1879.

12. Holt, Joseph: Cases of yellow fever in New Orleans in 1876. (Dr.
Holt was Sanitary Inspector for Fourth District, New Orleans,
1876--). New Orleans, 1876.

THE TULANE UNIVERSITY OF LOUISIANA
NEW ORLEANS
----
SCHOOL OF MEDICINE

13. Gros, A.A. and Gerardin, N.V.A.: Rapport fait à la Société médicale
(Nouvelle Orleans) sur la fièvre jaune qui a régné d'une manière
épidémique pendant l'été de 1817. New Orleans, 1818.

14. Marechal, Edwin L.: First recognized case of yellow fever in Mobile
in 1897, with comments and deductions. Mebile, 1898.

15. History and incidents of the plague in New Orleans (1853). Harper's
Magazine 7:797-806, 1853.
